newsitem.title: UK: New UK cable company eclipses rivals' market share.
newsitem.headline: New UK cable company eclipses rivals' market share.

text.p: The creation of a new UK cable giant from the merger of the UK operations of Cable & Wireless' Mercury, Videotron, Bell Cablemedia and NYNEX CableComms will eclipse its rivals in terms of domestic market share, figures show.

The merger, announced Tuesday, creates a new company called Cable & Wireless Communications in which C&W will hold a majority stake of 52.6 percent with NYNEX owning 18.5 percent, Bell Canada 14.2 percent, and 15 percent to be publicly floated.

The new company comprises all of Videotron which is being acquired by Bell Cablemedia in a complex deal in which C&W is taking a $338 million equity investment in Bell Cablemedia, valuing Videotron at around $1.09 billion.

Industry body the Cable Communications Association provided the following latest figures from the Independent Television Commission (ITC) which show UK market share for the top five cable operators as at August 28.

The newly merged company will have 2,472,000 homes passed, catapulting it into the top position ahead of Telewest.
However, analysts suggested that Telewest would not face direct competition from the new group as it mainly holds franchises for different areas.
